definitions.definition: To rub hard; to wash with rubbing; usually, to rub with a wet brush, or with something coarse or rough, for the purpose of cleaning or brightening
To rub anything hard, especially with a wet brush; to scour

examples: to scrub hard for a living

definitions.definition: To call off a scheduled event; to cancel .
examples: Engineers had to scrub the satellite launch due to bad weather.

definitions.definition: To eliminate or to correct data from a set of records to bring it inline with other similar datasets
examples: The street segment data from the National Post Office will need to be scrubbed before it can be integrated into our system.

definitions.definition: To move a recording tape back and forth with a scrubbing motion to produce a scratching sound, or to do so by a similar use of a control on an editing system.
To maneuver the play position on a media editing system by using a scroll bar or touch-based interface .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To rub hard; to wash with rubbing; usually, to rub with a wet brush, or with something coarse or rough, for the purpose of cleaning or brightening
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To rub anything hard, especially with a wet brush; to scour
( intransitive , figuratively ) To be diligent and penurious
( transitive ) To call off a scheduled event; to cancel .
( databases , transitive ) To eliminate or to correct data from a set of records to bring it inline with other similar datasets
( audio ) To move a recording tape back and forth with a scrubbing motion to produce a scratching sound, or to do so by a similar use of a control on an editing system.
( audio , video ) To maneuver the play position on a media editing system by using a scroll bar or touch-based interface .
